questions.question: In the context of polio in India, which of the following statements is correct regarding the different types of poliovirus (Type 1, Type 2, and Type 3)? poliovirus, with efforts ongoing to eradicate Type 1. poliovirus cases have been reported.

options.A: India has successfully eradicated Type 1, but Type 2 and Type 3 still remain a threat.
options.B: Type 2 poliovirus has been eradicated globally, and India is free from both Type 2 and Type 3
options.C: All three types of poliovirus are still prevalent in India, requiring continued vaccination efforts.
options.D: World Health Organization declared India polio-free in 2014, and no Type 1, Type 2, or Type 3

questions.explanation: Type 2, or Type 3 poliovirus cases have been reported. Correct Answer: D) World Health Organization declared India polio-free in 2014, and no Type 1, Type 2, or Type 3 poliovirus cases have been reported Explanation: India was declared polio-free by the WHO in 2014. The last reported case of Type 1 poliovirus in India was in January 2011. Type 2 poliovirus was eradicated globally in 1999. The last detected Type 3 case was in Nov 2012 and declared eradicated in Oct 2019. Current efforts are focused on Preventing any resurgence of Type 1 poliovirus Regular surveillance Maintaining high vaccination coverage prevents the outbreak and ensures the country remains polio-free.

questions.question: Which of the following Hepatitis B virus (HBV) markers is correctly paired with its significance?

options.A: HBsAg + HBeAg + IgM - Indicates acute infection with high infectivity
options.B: HBsAg + HBeAg + IgG- Indicates acute infection in recovery phase
options.C: Anti-HBc only - Indicates immunity due to vaccination
options.D: Anti-HBs + HBeAg + IgG - Indicates recovery from infection in recent past

questions.explanation: Correct Answer: A) HBsAg (Hepatitis B surface antigen) - Indicates active infection Explanation: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that affects the liver and can lead to acute and chronic diseases. Diagnosis and management of Hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection rely on detecting specific viral markers in the blood . These markers help determine the phase of disease, the degree of infectivity, and the patient's immune status. Understanding the significance of each marker is crucial for accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. options.A: Sodium: 75 mmol/L, Glucose: 75 mmol/L, Potassium: 20 mmol/L, Chloride: 65 mmol/L, Citrate: 10

questions.explanation: mmol/L, Citrate: 10 mmol/L, Total Osmolarity: 245 mOsm/L Correct Answer: A) Sodium: 75 mmol/L, Glucose: 75 mmol/L, Potassium: 20 mmol/L, Chloride: 65 mmol/L, Citrate: 10 mmol/L, Total Osmolarity: 245 mOsm/L Explanation: Oral Rehydration Solution (ORS) therapy is based on the principle that glucose facilitates salt and water absorption in the intestine, thereby restoring electrolyte and fluid balance. WHO and UNICEF recommend the use of reduced osmolarity ORS due to the following advantages: Lower sodium and glucose concentrations decrease osmolarity, reducing the risk of adverse effects associated with hypertonicity. Trisodium citrate enhances sodium and water absorption, resulting in reduced stool output. Composition of Reduced Osmolarity ORS: Component mmol/L Sodium 75 Chloride 65 Glucose anhydrous 75 Potassium 20 Citrate 10 Total osmolarity 245 Substance Weight (g/L) Sodium chloride 2.6 Glucose, anhydrous 13.5 Potassium chloride 1.5 Trisodium citrate, dihydrate 2.9 Total weight 20.5 Reference: K. Park’s Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine, Edition 27. Page: 266

questions.question: Which of the following is an additional ion present in ReSoMal?
questions.explanation: Correct Answer: D) Magnesium Explanation: ReSoMal (Rehydration Solution for Malnutrition) is specifically designed to rehydrate severely malnourished children suffering from diarrhea-related dehydration. Comparison of ReSoMal vs Standard ORS: Component ReSoMal Standard ORS Sodium 45 90 Potassium 40 20 Chloride 70 80 Citrate 7 10 Magnesium 3 - Zinc 0.3 - Copper 0.045 - Glucose 125 111 Osmolarity 300 311 Severely malnourished children often have imbalanced electrolyte levels. ReSoMal is specifically formulated to address these imbalances, providing lower sodium and higher potassium and magnesium levels compared to standard ORS. The lower sodium content in ReSoMal minimizes the risk of hypernatremia. Additional nutrients like magnesium, zinc, and copper support overall recovery and immune function. Reference: MANAGEMENT OF SEVERE MALNUTRITION: A MANUAL FOR PHYSICIANS AND OTHER SENIOR HEALTH WORKERS

questions.question: A 2-year-old child presents with 2-3 episodes of diarrhea and on examination for skin returns quickly when pinched, there is no excessive thirst or refusal to drink fluids and the child accepts fluids or food orally without any difficulty. Which of the following management steps is incorrect for treating the child at home concerning the clinical symptoms? dehydration.

options.A: Counsel the mother to give extra fluids and continue feeding.
options.B: Provide frequent small sips of 50-100 ml of fluid after each loose stool.
options.C: Mandatory administration of ORS solution every 2 hours to prevent signs and symptoms of
options.D: Give zinc supplementation of 20mg for 14 days.

questions.explanation: symptoms of dehydration. Correct Answer: C) Mandatory administration of ORS solution every 2 hours to prevent signs and symptoms of dehydration. Explanation: ORS solution is unnecessary if the child suffers from mild diarrhea and there are no signs of dehydration. In mild diarrhea, fluids/ORS should be given according to the child’s needs. Plan Criteria Management Steps A Mild diarrhea, no dehydration Counsel the mother to give extra fluids, continue feeding, give zinc supplements, follow up. Fluids: Small sips (50-100 ml after each loose stool for children up to 2 years, 100-200 ml for children over 2 years). Zinc: 20 mg tab for two months to 5 years (dissolve in breast milk or ORS for infants). B Moderate dehydration Administer ORS in a clinical setting: Amount based on weight and age (e.g., 450-800 ml for children 6-10 kg). Reassess hydration status after 4 hours. C Severe dehydration If possible, provide immediate IV fluids; otherwise, start ORS by mouth while setting up the IV. The dosage is 100 ml/kg Ringer's Lactate or normal saline over 1-5 hours, depending on the patient's age. Reassess every 1-2 hours, switch to ORS as the child stabilizes, and continue monitoring and using the appropriate hydration method (IV/NG/ORS). Reference: K. Park’s Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine, Edition 27, Page: 688, 689

options.A: The predominant serotype of cholera in India is the El Tor biotype of Vibrio cholerae O1.
options.B: holera is no longer a notifiable disease locally and nationally, but remains notifiable internationally.
options.C: The oral cholera vaccine Dukoral includes a recombinant cholera toxin B subunit and is suitable for
options.D: Shanchol and mORCVAX are oral cholera vaccines based on serogroups O1 and O139, used for

questions.explanation: subunit and is suitable for children under two years. Correct Answer: C) The oral cholera vaccine Dukoral includes a recombinant cholera toxin B subunit and is suitable for children under 2 years. Explanation:- Dukoral is an oral inactivated cholera vaccine that contains killed V. cholerae O1 and a recombinant B subunit of cholera toxin . However, Dukoral is not recommended for children under 2 years of age . Hence, the statement is incorrect . Cholera Vaccines and Use Vaccine Contains Age Group Notes Dukoral Killed V. cholerae O1 + recombinant B subunit ≥ 2 years Requires buffer; provides short-term protection Shanchol Killed V. cholerae O1 and O139 ≥ 1 year Used in endemic/outbreak settings mORCVAX Killed V. cholerae O1 and O139 ≥ 1 year Similar to Shanchol The predominant serotype of cholera in India is the El Tor biotype of Vibrio cholerae O1. (Option A): Correct. El Tor biotype is the major cause of cholera outbreaks in India and many parts of Asia. Cholera is no longer a notifiable disease locally and nationally, but remains notifiable internationally. (Option B): Correct. As per the International Health Regulations (IHR), cholera is still internationally notifiable , even if it’s not locally reportable in some countries. Shanchol and mORCVAX are oral cholera vaccines based on serogroups O1 and O139, used for individuals over 1 year of age. (Option D): Correct. Both are killed whole-cell vaccines effective against O1 and O139 strains and are administered to individuals aged ≥ 1 year . Reference: K. Park’s Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine, Edition 27, Page 270-276

The causative agent is Salmonella typhi. (Option A) Reservoir Man is the only reservoir for typhoid infection.
